An intern encrypted a secret with RSA, but unknowingly chose both primes as Blum integers. Can you recover the flag from 4216619655430564237456953130670722181369693804673762861454819356003893858153692866165658560722537576663578300700815191348914090295855682348489037766305843?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=8333599983942307533673382573530962575892966763428199278478373263639556261586125453413846352674977396545347606861182830590913284075342097047198787618439869, e=1399480879127120695737425720154783975281314154369636181029643108115552333275583653494570862188597234967094361296052166258613392021864703872670013435388655
The lower 104 bits of p are: 20823260270160963153809431836175138695


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{l7x2j3by}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4216619655430564237456953130670722181369693804673762861454819356003893858153692866165658560722537576663578300700815191348914090295855682348489037766305843
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=8333599983942307533673382573530962575892966763428199278478373263639556261586125453413846352674977396545347606861182830590913284075342097047198787618439869, e=1399480879127120695737425720154783975281314154369636181029643108115552333275583653494570862188597234967094361296052166258613392021864703872670013435388655
The lower 104 bits of p are: 20823260270160963153809431836175138695

extra_info: p=72468851652357081127246171662797599433781762821929946064805571919632249421703, q=114995612513907601648890448224945092696947089411862098519553571365515570336923, Ï†(n)=8333599983942307533673382573530962575892966763428199278478373263639556261585937988949680087992201259925459864169052101738679492030757737903913639798681244
